definitions.definition: To restore to a former place, position, condition, etc.; to put back
definitions.example: When you've finished using the telephone, please replace the handset.

definitions.definition: To refund; to repay; to pay back
definitions.example: You can take what you need from the petty cash, but you must replace it tomorrow morning.

definitions.definition: To supply or substitute an equivalent for
definitions.example: I replaced my car with a newer model.

definitions.definition: To take over the position or role from.
To take the place of; to be used instead of
definitions.example: This security pass replaces the one you were given earlier.

definitions.definition: To demolish (a building) and build an updated form of that building in its place.
To put in a new or different place.
